intro: Psychotria subcrocea var. confusa, commonly known as the "Cape Verde Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Cape Verde Islands and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often fragrant. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
